Ingest_LDD.name: MRO
Ingest_LDD.comment:
The MRO dictionary contains classes that describe aspects of the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter mission and related instruments.
MRO version 1.3.1.0 PDS Build 1.20.0.0, 1.21.0.0, 1.22.0.0, LDDTool version 14.0.13
Built with lddtool -plJ PDS4_MRO_IngestLDD.xml
2022-09-27 JGW. Revised SCLK pattern to allow between 3 and 6 fractional digits. Added release_id.
2022-09-29 JGW. Added SHARAD_Parameters class. Reorganized attribute definitions.
2022-12-02 DVP. Added CRISM_ATO_Parameters class.
2022-12-06 DVP. Bumped to version 1.1.0.0 because of addition of class.
2022-12-22 PG (pgeissler@usgs.gov) added HiRISE parameters, bumped to 1.2.0.0
2023-03-23 PG (pgeissler@usgs.gov) added HiRISE RDR class
2023-08-16 DVP. Modifications to some parameters of CRISM_ATO_Parameters class following urn:nasa:pds:crism_ato_s_iof_lml peer review; bumped to 1.2.1.0.
2023-08-31 PG (pgeissler@usgs.gov) added observation_rationale attribute for HiRISE, bump to 1.2.2.0
2024-01-09 JGW. Added SHARAD_Observation_Parameters class
2024-02-27 PG fixes to HiRISE, 1.3.1.0

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name attribute provides the mission-defined name of a time period within the mission.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_rationale
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_rationale attribute identifies the name of the specific feature on Mars that was targeted by the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: orbit_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The orbit_number attribute identifies the orbit number when the observation was taken.

DD_Attribute.name: producer_institution_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_institution_name attribute identifies the name of the institution that created the data product.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type attribute identifies the type of data product.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Map-Projected Targeted Reduced Data Record - Browse
Map-Projected Targeted Reduced Data Record - Extras
Image orthorectified to a digital terrain model

DD_Attribute.name: product_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_version_id element identifies the version of an individual data product.

DD_Attribute.name: release_id
DD_Attribute.definition: release_id is the identifier of a scheduled release of MRO data from PDS. The first MRO data release has release_number "0001". The release_number for a given product is always the first release in which it appears, and does not change if the product is revised later.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_count_partition attribute indicates the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count attributes.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop_count attribute provides the value of the spacecraft clock at the end of a time period of interest.

DD_Attribute.name: line_prefix_bytes
DD_Attribute.definition: The line prefix bytes attribute reports the number of bytes that precede the observational data for each line of a HiRISE or CTX image. For HiRISE, the prefix includes 6 bytes of line identification information and the values of 12 buffer pixels, which contain the value of empty pixels after going through the instrument electronics.

DD_Attribute.name: line_suffix_bytes
DD_Attribute.definition: The line suffix bytes attribute reports the number of bytes that follow the observational data for each line of a HiRISE or CTX image. For HiRISE, the suffix contains 16 dark reference pixel values produced by masked detectors.

DD_Attribute.name: activity_id
DD_Attribute.definition:
The activity_id attribute describes the type of measurement contained in a CRISM EDR or other data product, and provides indication of how the observation is commanded. The format of the value is AC### where AC is a 2-letter designation of the type of measurement made, and ### is a 3-numeral designation of the instrument command macro that was executed to acquire the data. Macro numbers are in the range 0-255.
For EDRs, BI is measurement of detector bias, DF is a measurement of background including dark current and thermal background, LP is measurement of a focal plane lamp, SP is measurement of the internal integrating sphere, and SC is measurement of an external scene. TP indicates that the EDR contains any test pattern produced by instrument electronics. T1 through T7 specify the test pattern, test pattern 1 through test pattern 7. UN indicates that the EDR contains data in which housekeeping does not match the commanded instrument configuration.
For an RDR, RA indicates that the file contains values in units of radiance (W m^-2 nm^-1 sr^-1). IF indicates that the file contains values in units of I/F, or radiance divided by solar flux scaled for heliocentric distance. AL indicates that the file contains values as estimated Labert albedo, which is I/F corrected for cosine of incidence angle and for atmospheric and thermal effects. SU indicates that the files contains summary parameters, unitless values derived from Lambert albedo.
For an RDR or a DDR, DE indicates that the files contains derived values related to observation geometry or independently characterized properties of the scene.

DD_Attribute.name: band_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the name of the CRISM band associated with the specific scaling and offset parameters used in a CRISM browse product.

DD_Attribute.name: band_sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Defines the order of the CRISM bands along the Axis_Array when axis_name is band.

DD_Attribute.name: detector_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the CRISM IR detector (if sensor_id = 'L'), or the VNIR detector (if SENSOR_ID = 'S'). On each detector there are two temperature sensors. The primary source of IR detector temperature is IR temperature sensor 1 (column 50 in the EDR list file). The backup source of IR detector temperature is IR temperature sensor 2 (column 51 in the EDR list file). The primary source of VNIR detector temperature is VNIR temperature sensor 2 (column 65 in the EDR list file). The backup source of VNIR detector temperature is VNIR temperature sensor 1 (column 64 in the EDR list file).

DD_Attribute.name: fpe_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The fpe_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE or CRISM instrument's Focal Plane Electronics in degrees Celsius. For HiRISE, see Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004. For CRISM, the value refers to the focal plane electronics board mounted in the base of the gimbal. The values represents IR focal plane electronics if SENSOR_ID = 'L', and to the VNIR focal plane electronics if SENSOR_ID = 'S'. The source of CRISM IR focal plane electronics temperature is column 60 in the EDR list file. The source of VNIR focal plane electronics temperature is column 71 in the EDR list file.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_id attribute is a 8-byte hexadecimal integer uniquely identifying the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_number attribute gives the monotonically increasing ordinal counter of the EDRs generated for a particular CRISM observation_id. CRISM generates several EDRs for a given observation_id.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_type attribute identifies the general type of observation.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: No valid EDRs within observation that indicate class type

DD_Attribute.name: optical_bench_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The optical_bench_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the CRISM optical bench. It is a backup to sphere_temperature for modeling the output radiance of the onboard integrating sphere as a function of sphere temperature.

DD_Attribute.name: scaling_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: The scaling_factor attribute is the scaling factor to be applied to each stored value in order to recover an original value. The observed value (Ov) is calculated from the stored value (Sv) thus: Ov = (Sv * scaling_factor) + value_offset.

DD_Attribute.name: sensor_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The sensor_id attribute identifies the CRISM focal plane from which data in an EDR or RDR were returned; S = short-wavelength or VNIR, L = long-wavelength or IR, J = joint where a data product is applicable to either.

DD_Attribute.name: spectrometer_housing_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectrometer_housing_temperature attribute gives the temperature of the CRISM spectrometer housing. This is a backup to direct determination, using measurements with the shutter closed, of the thermal background measured by the IR detector. The primary source of this temperature is a measurement digitized by the VNIR focal plane electronics, column 58 in the EDR list file. The backup source of this temperature is a measurement digitized by the IR focal plane electronics, column 69 in the EDR list file.

DD_Attribute.name: sphere_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The sphere_temperature attribute gives the temperature of the CRISM onboard integrating sphere. It is used for modeling the output radiance of the sphere as a function of sphere temperature.

DD_Attribute.name: value_offset
DD_Attribute.definition: The value_offset attribute is the offset to be applied to each stored value in order to recover an original value. The observed value (Ov) is calculated from the stored value (Sv) thus: Ov = (Sv * scaling_factor) + value_offset.

DD_Attribute.name: array_first_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The array_first_value element provides the first value in an ascending series and is therefore the minimum value at which a given data item was sampled.

DD_Attribute.name: array_interval
DD_Attribute.definition: The array_interval attribute provides the spacing of points at which data are sampled and at which values for an instrument or other parameter are available. If x1 and xn are the first and last sampling parameter values, respectively, xn is larger than x1, n is the number of sampling parameters, the caret symbol (^) denotes exponentiation, and b, a positive real number, is the base for exponentiation, then the value of sampling_parameter_interval is: (xn-x1)/(n-1) (for sampling_parameter_scale = Linear), (xn/x1)^(1/(n-1)) (for sampling_parameter_scale = Logarithmic), (b^xn-b^x1)/(n-1) (for sampling_parameter_scale = Exponential).

DD_Attribute.name: array_last_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The array_last_value element provides the last value in an ascending series and is therefore the maximum value at which a given data item was sampled.

DD_Attribute.name: array_scale
DD_Attribute.definition: The array_scale attribute specifies whether the sampling interval is linear or something other such as logarithmic.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Values of Uniformly Sampled are given at uniform (linear) spacings of an independent variable - for example, 1, 2, 3, 4, ...

The values of the independent variable in exponential uniformly sampled data are given at uniform spacing of the exponential of some base b, a positive real number. That is, for independent variable x in the range [x1, xn], the sampling points xj satisfy: b^xj = b^x1 + (j-1)(b^xn - b^x1)/(n-1) for j = 1 ... n where the caret symbol (^) denotes exponentiation. For example, if the independent variable has values 0., 0.30103, 0.47712, 0.60206, ... and the base is 10, then the Exponential Uniformly Spaced data are given at 10^0., 10^0.30103, 10^0.47712, 10^0.60206, ... or 1, 2, 3, 4, ...

The values of the independent variable, x, in logarithmic uniformly sampled data are given at uniform spacing of the logarithm of x in some base, b, a positive real number. That is, for independent variable x in the range [x1, xn], the sampling points xj satisfy: log_b(xj) = log_b(x1) + (j-1)(log_b(xn) - log_b(x1))/(n-1) for j = 1 ... n where log_b(x) is the log of x in base b. For example, if the independent variable has values 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... and the base is 10, then the Logarithmic Uniformly Spaced data are given at 0, 1, 2, 3 ...

DD_Attribute.name: array_unit
DD_Attribute.definition: The array_unit element specifies the unit of measure of associated data sampling parameters.

DD_Attribute.name: azimuth_processing_window
DD_Attribute.definition: The windowing function used to reduce sidelobes resulting from azimuth (along-track) synthetic aperture processing of the raw echo records. All radargrams in the SHARAD radargram archive use a Hann function.

DD_Attribute.name: chirp_frequency_envelope
DD_Attribute.definition: The frequency-dependent amplitude variation used in range compression of the raw echo data. All radargrams in the SHARAD radargram archive use a uniform-amplitude model.

DD_Attribute.name: multilook_doppler_bandwidth
DD_Attribute.definition: The frequency span over which radar echoes are averaged, following synthetic aperture processing for each spatial footprint along the ground track. This frequency span is measured to either side of the zero-frequency component of the Doppler spectrum.

DD_Attribute.name: name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name element provides the name of the parameter which determines the sampling interval of a particular instrument or dataset parameter. For example, magnetic field intensity is sampled in time increments, and a spectrum is sampled in wavelength or frequency.

DD_Attribute.name: number_of_looks
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of frequency-resolved cells included in the multi-look averaging. This varies with the chosen frequency span and the Doppler resolution set by the inverse of the coherent integration time.

DD_Attribute.name: range_compression_window
DD_Attribute.definition: The windowing function used to reduce sidelobes resulting from range compression of the raw echo records. All radargrams in the SHARAD radargram archive use a Hann function.

DD_Attribute.name: synthetic_aperture_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The coherent integration time for SHARAD signals processed using the synthetic aperture technique. Multiplication of this value by the MRO tangential velocity tabulated in the SHARAD radargram *GEOM.TAB files yields an approximate physical length of the aperture.

DD_Attribute.name: max_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: The index of the highest-numbered sample/column of this product relative to the original CRISM scene. The first sample of the original CRISM scene corresponds to a value of 1.

DD_Attribute.name: max_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The index of the highest-numbered line/row of this product relative to the original CRISM scene. The first line of the original CRISM scene corresponds to a value of 1.

DD_Attribute.name: min_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: The index of the lowest-numbered sample/column of this product relative to the original CRISM scene. The first sample of the original CRISM scene corresponds to a value of 1.

DD_Attribute.name: min_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The index of the lowest-numbered line/row of this product relative to the original CRISM scene. The first line of the original CRISM scene corresponds to a value of 1.

DD_Attribute.name: analog_power_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The analog_power_start_count attribute provides the spacecraft clock count when power to the CPMM units was applied.

DD_Attribute.name: analog_power_start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The analog_power_start_time attribute provides the UTC time when power to the CPMM units was applied.

DD_Attribute.name: calibration_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The calibration_start_count attribute provides the spacecraft clock count at the beginning of the first calibration image line.

DD_Attribute.name: calibration_start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The calibration_start_time attribute provides the UTC time at the beginning of the first calibration image line.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_start_time attribute provides the UTC start time of a HiRISE image acquisition sequence.

DD_Attribute.name: readout_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The readout_start_count attribute provides the spacecraft clock count when the HiRISE CCD Process/Memory Module begins transferring image data out of its buffer memory.

DD_Attribute.name: readout_start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The readout_start_time attribute provides the UTC time when the HiRISE CCD Process/Memory Module begins transferring image data out of buffer memory.

DD_Attribute.name: adc_timing_settings_image
DD_Attribute.definition: The adc_timing_settings_image attribute provides the HiRISE Channel 0 analog-to-digital conversion timing settings for the readout of the video waveform.

DD_Attribute.name: adc_timing_settings_reset
DD_Attribute.definition: The adc_timing_settings_reset attribute provides the HiRISE Channel 0 analog-to-digital conversion timing settings for the reset of the video waveform.

DD_Attribute.name: binning
channel_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The channel_number attribute provides the HiRISE CCD channel number.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_number attribute provides the HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Module number.

DD_Attribute.name: delta_line_timer_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The delta_line_timer_count element provides the commanded count given to the HiRISE instrument to set the scan line duration. mro:scan_line_duration = 74 + mro:delta_line_timer_count/16

DD_Attribute.name: dll_frequency_correct_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_frequency_correct_count attribute provides a count of the number of times the HiRISE 96 MHz clock frequency was observed to be correct. This is used with the recursive Digital Lock Loop reset circuit.

DD_Attribute.name: dll_locked_flag_01
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_locked_flag_01 attribute provides the state of the 1st 96 Mhz Digital Lock Loop flag for a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: dll_locked_flag_02
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_locked_flag_02 attribute provides the state of the 2nd 96 Mhz Digital Lock Loop flag for a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: dll_locked_once_flag_01
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_locked_once_flag_01 attribute indicates if the 1st Digital Lock Loop ever locked during a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: dll_locked_once_flag_02
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_locked_once_flag_02 attribute indicates if the 2nd Digital Lock Loop ever locked during a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: dll_reset_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The dll_reset_count attribute provides the count of the number of times during a HiRISE observation the 96 MHz Digital Lock Loop had to be reset in order to lock to the incoming 48 Mhz clock and produce an 96 MHz clock.

DD_Attribute.name: felics_compression_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The felics_compression_flag element identifies whether FELICS data compression was applied to a HiRISE image.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_position_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_position_count attribute provides the raw count of the focus mechanism position in a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_00
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_01
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_02
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_03
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_04
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_05
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_06
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_07
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_08
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_09
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_10
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_11
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_12
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_flag_13
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_flag element is a set of 14 on/off flags that indicate which of the 14 heater control areas were on at the time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_control_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_control_mode attribute provides the state of the HiRISE heater control, either closed-loop or duty-cycle. Normally the closed-loop mode is used to keep nominal operating temperatures of the instrument. A duty-cycle mode is enabled during periods of high EM emissions from other MRO instruments.

DD_Attribute.name: image_exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The image_exposure_duration attribute provides the total time of a HiRISE observation from the start of the first line to the end of the last line computed by multiplying the total number of lines in the array times the line exposure duration. Units of microseconds.

DD_Attribute.name: line_exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The line_exposure_duration attribute provides the time from the start of exposure of one binned line to the start of exposure of the next binned line in a HiRISE image. Units of microseconds.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_k_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_k_value attribute provides the 'pixel spread' value in a HiRISE image. This parameter is used only for the HiRISE SQUARE-ROOT LUT table mode. A -9998 value indicates a K value was not used.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_maximum
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_maximum attribute provides the maximum 14-bit pixel value mapped to the 254 DN 8-bit pixel in a HiRISE image. This parameter is used only for the HiRISE LINEAR LUT table mode. A -9998 value indicates that the maximum value was not used.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_median
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_median attribute provides the median 14-bit pixel value mapped to the 254 DN 8-bit pixel in a HiRISE image. This parameter is used only for the HiRISE SQUARE-ROOT LUT table mode. A -9998 value indicates that the table median value was not used.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_minimum
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_minimum attribute provides the minimum 14-bit pixel value mapped to the 0 DN output pixel in a HiRISE image. This parameter is used only for the HiRISE LINEAR LUT table mode. A -9998 value indicates that the maximum value was not used.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_number attribute provides the number of the stored LUT used in a HiRISE image. This parameter is used only for the HiRISE STORED LUT table mode. A value of -9998 indicates that a table number was not used.

DD_Attribute.name: lookup_table_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The lookup_table_type attribute provides the type of lookup table that was applied to convert 14-bit pixels to 8-bit pixels in a HiRISE image.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_00
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_01
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_02
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_03
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_04
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_05
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_06
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_07
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_08
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_09
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_10
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_11
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_12
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: powered_cpmm_flag_13
DD_Attribute.definition: The powered_cpmm_flag attribute provides a set of 14 values that identify which HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Modules were commanded to acquire imaging during the observation. The first element is for CPMM 0 and the last element is for CPMM 13.

DD_Attribute.name: scan_exposure_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The scan_exposure_duration attribute provides the unbinned line readout rate of the HiRISE instrument in microseconds. This corresponds to the time between successive steps in the Time Delay Integration (TDI) process. The adjustment of this parameter is used to match image line acquisition to the boresight ground velocity. The value is the same for all CCDs for a given observation.

DD_Attribute.name: stimulation_lamp_flag_red
DD_Attribute.definition: The stimulation_lamp_flag attribute is a set of three flags that identify which of the three HiRISE stimulation lamps have been turned on or off. Stimulation lamps are used to evaluate relative changes in instrument calibration throughout the mission. Stimulation lamps are always turned off for science observation data.

DD_Attribute.name: stimulation_lamp_flag_nir
DD_Attribute.definition: The stimulation_lamp_flag attribute is a set of three flags that identify which of the three HiRISE stimulation lamps have been turned on or off. Stimulation lamps are used to evaluate relative changes in instrument calibration throughout the mission. Stimulation lamps are always turned off for science observation data.

DD_Attribute.name: stimulation_lamp_flag_blg
DD_Attribute.definition: The stimulation_lamp_flag attribute is a set of three flags that identify which of the three HiRISE stimulation lamps have been turned on or off. Stimulation lamps are used to evaluate relative changes in instrument calibration throughout the mission. Stimulation lamps are always turned off for science observation data.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi
DD_Attribute.definition: The tdi attribute provides the number of time delay and integration (TDI) stages used to increase the exposure time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: trim_lines
DD_Attribute.definition: The trim_lines attribute provides the number of lines that have been trimmed at the beginning of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: barrel_baffle_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The barrel_baffle_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's barrel baffle in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_pws_board_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_pws_board_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's CCD Processing/Memory Module Power Supply Board in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: field_stop_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The field_stop_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's focus mechanism field stop in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: focus_motor_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The focus_motor_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's focus mirror in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: fpa_negative_y_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The fpa_negative_y_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's Focal Plane Array -Y location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: fpa_positive_y_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The fpa_positive_y_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's Focal Plane Array +Y side location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: iea_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The iea_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's Instrument Electronics Assembly in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ie_pws_board_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ie_pws_board_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's Instrument Electronics Power Supply Board in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: inst_cont_board_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The inst_cont_board_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument control board in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: mech_tlm_board_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The mech_tlm_board_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's Mech/TLM Board in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_0_a_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_0_a_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 0-A leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_0_b_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_0_b_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 0-B leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_120_a_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_120_a_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 120-A leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_120_b_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_120_b_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 120-B leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_240_a_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_240_a_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 240-A leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: ms_truss_leg_240_b_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ms_truss_leg_240_b_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's metering structure truss 240-B leg in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_box_beam_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_box_beam_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench near the box beam (+Y face) in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_cover_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_cover_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench cover (external) in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_flexure_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_flexure_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench near the +X MDR flexure in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_fold_flat_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_fold_flat_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical fold flat mirror location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_fpa_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_fpa_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench near the Focal Plane Array in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_fpe_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_fpe_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench near the Focal Plane Electronics in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_living_rm_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_living_rm_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench in the sunken living room location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: opt_bnch_mirror_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The opt_bnch_mirror_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's optical bench near the tertiary mirror in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: primary_mirror_baf_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The primary_mirror_baf_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's primary mirror baffle near the base (external) in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: primary_mirror_mnt_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The primary_mirror_mnt_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's primary mirror mount in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: primary_mirror_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The primary_mirror_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's primary mirror at its maximum thickness in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: sec_mirror_baffle_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The sec_mirror_baffle_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's secondary mirror baffle near the base (external) in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: sec_mirror_mtr_rng_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The sec_mirror_mtr_rng_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's secondary mirror metering ring in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: sec_mirror_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The sec_mirror_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's secondary mirror in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: spider_leg_150_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The spider_leg_150_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's spider leg at the 150 degree location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: spider_leg_270_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The spider_leg_270_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's spider leg at the 270 degree location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: spider_leg_30_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The spider_leg_30_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's spider leg at the 30 degree location in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: sun_shade_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The sun_shade_temperature attribute provides the temperature of the HiRISE instrument's sun shade under the MLI in degrees Centigrade. See Figure 2.3, MRO HiRISE EDR SIS, REFKEYID JPLD-32004.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_negative_5_current
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_negative_5_current attribute provides the negative 5 current of the HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Module.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_negative_5_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_negative_5_voltage attribute provides the negative 5 voltage state of the HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Module.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_positive_2_5_current

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_positive_5_current
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_positive_5_current attribute provides the positive 5 current of the HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Module.

DD_Attribute.name: cpmm_positive_5_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The cpmm_positive_5_voltage attribute provides the positive 5 voltage state of the HiRISE CCD Processing/Memory Module.

DD_Attribute.name: heater_current
DD_Attribute.definition: The heater_current attribute provides the HiRISE heater current in amps.

DD_Attribute.name: iea_negative_15_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The iea_negative_15_voltage attribute provides the negative 15 voltage state of the HiRISE Interface Electronics Assembly.

DD_Attribute.name: iea_positive_15_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The iea_positive_15_voltage attribute provides the positive 15 voltage state of the HiRISE Interface Electronics Assembly.

DD_Attribute.name: iea_positive_28_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The iea_positive_28_voltage attribute provides the positive 28 voltage state of the HiRISE Interface Electronics Assembly.

DD_Attribute.name: iea_positive_5_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The iea_positive_5_voltage attribute provides the positive 5 voltage state of the HiRISE Interface Electronics Assembly.

DD_Attribute.name: inst_cont_fpga_pos_2_5_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The inst_cont_fpga_pos_2_5_voltage attribute provides the positive 2_5 voltage state of the HiRISE instrument control Field-Programmable Gate Array.

DD_Attribute.name: mech_tlm_fpga_pos_2_5_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: The mech_tlm_fpga_pos_2_5_voltage attribute provides the positive 2_5 voltage state of the HiRISE Mech/TLM Field-Programmable Gate Array.

ccd_flag_red0
DD_Attribute.definition: The ccd_flag elements identify which CCDs were operating at the time of an observation. There is a special processing flag for each CCD used in the observation.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: the CCD was actively acquiring data during the observation.
the CCD was turned off during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_stretch
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_stretch attribute provides a contrast stretch value to be used in the display of a HiRISE Image. The mro.maximum_stretch parameter specifies the DN value to map to the 255 DN value of the display. For color images, there will be three values, one for each color.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_stretch
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_stretch attribute provides a contrast stretch value to be used in the display of a HiRISE Image. The mro.minimum_stretch parameter specifies the DN value to map to the 0 DN value of the display. For color images, there will be three values, one for each color.

DD_Attribute.name: special_processing_flag_red0
DD_Attribute.definition: The special_processing_flag elements indicate if special calibration processing was applied to a HiRISE CCD image. The HiRISE instrument may experience instability problems or a low-signal image may have been poorly calibrated requiring an alternate calibration strategy. There is a special processing flag for each CCD used in the observation.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: the standard calibration processing was used for the CCD image.
the calibration processing used a columnar gain correction based on columnar statistics of the image.
the CCD was not operating or was missing for this observation.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_ir10
DD_Attribute.definition: The tdi attribute provides the number of time delay and integration (TDI) stages used to increase the exposure time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_ir11
DD_Attribute.definition: The tdi attribute provides the number of time delay and integration (TDI) stages used to increase the exposure time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_bg12
DD_Attribute.definition: The tdi attribute provides the number of time delay and integration (TDI) stages used to increase the exposure time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Attribute.name: tdi_bg13
DD_Attribute.definition: The tdi attribute provides the number of time delay and integration (TDI) stages used to increase the exposure time of a HiRISE observation.

DD_Class.name: HiRISE_Time_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The HiRISE_Time_Parameters class contains attributes specific to HiRISE EDRs.

DD_Class.name: HiRISE_Instrument_Setting_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The HiRISE_Instrument_Setting_Parameters class contains attributes specific to HiRISE EDRs.

DD_Class.name: HiRISE_Temperature_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The HiRISE_Temperature_Parameters class contains attributes specific to HiRISE EDRs.

DD_Class.name: HiRISE_Power_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The HiRISE_Power_Parameters class contains attributes specific to HiRISE EDRs.

DD_Class.name: HiRISE_RDR_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The HiRISE_RDR_Parameters class contains attributes specific to HiRISE RDRs.

DD_Class.name: CRISM_Temperatures
DD_Class.definition: The CRISM_Temperatures class is the container for CRISM-specific temperature-related parameters.

DD_Class.name: CRISM_Band
DD_Class.definition: The CRISM_Band class contains parameters describing a single band in CRISM Browse Product 3D image array or in the CRISM data cube containing refined spectral summary parameters.

DD_Class.name: CRISM_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The CRISM_Parameters class is the container for CRISM-specific observation parameters.

DD_Class.name: CRISM_ATO_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The CRISM_ATO_Parameters class is the container for observation parameters specific to the CRISM ATO (Along-Track Oversampled) reprocessing project.

DD_Class.name: SHARAD_Observation_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The SHARAD_Observation_Parameters class provides parameters for SHARAD radar observations.

DD_Class.name: Array_Sampled
DD_Class.definition: The Array_Sampled class class provides parameters for a uniformly sampled array.

DD_Class.name: SHARAD_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The SHARAD_Parameters class contains attributes specific to SHARAD data.

DD_Class.name: MRO_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The MRO_Parameters class is the container for mission-specific metadata elements.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mro:error:sclk_rule_0: If mro:spacecraft_clock_start_count and mro:spacecraft_clock_stop_count are present, they must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by mro:spacecraft_clock_count_partition.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count are present, they must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by spacecraft_clock_count_partition.
